name: The number of divisors of n whose largest prime factor is 3.
comment: The number of 3-smooth divisors of n that are not powers of 2.
The number of terms of A065119 that divide n.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 0 if and only if n is in A001651.
a(n) = 1 if and only if n is in A306771.
In general, the asymptotic mean of the number prime(k+1)-smooth divisors of n that are not prime(k)-smooth, for k >= 1, is (1/(prime(k+1)-1)) * Product_{i=1..k} (prime(i)/(prime(i)-1)).
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Mar 29 2025

name: The number of unitary 3-smooth divisors of n.
comment: Continued fraction expansion of 10/(6 + sqrt(66)) (with offset 0).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,0,1).
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = 2 if p <= 3, and 1 otherwise.
a(n) = A034444(n) if and only if n is 3-smooth (A003586).
a(n) = A072078(n) if and only if n is squarefree (A005117).
xref: The number of unitary prime(k)-smooth divisors of n: A134451 (k = 1), this sequence (k = 2), A382489 (k = 3).
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Mar 29 2025
